title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic romance novel depicting the manners and matrimonial machinations of the British Regency.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality, told through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A tragic story of Jay Gatsby, a self-made millionaire, and his pursuit of Daisy Buchanan.

title: Normal People
author: Sally Rooney
description: An exploration of the complex relationship between two teenagers, Marianne and Connell, in modern Ireland.

title: The Girl on the Train
author: Paula Hawkins
description: A psychological thriller about an alcoholic divorcee who becomes entangled in a missing persons investigation.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A suspense novel about a woman who disappears on her fifth wedding anniversary and the husband who becomes the prime suspect.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: A murder mystery and a coming-of-age story about a young girl who raises herself in the marshes of North Carolina.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the future.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychological thriller about a woman's act of violence against her husband and the therapist obsessed with uncovering her motive.

title: A Little Life
author: Hanya Yanagihara
description: A novel following four college classmates as they move to New York in search of fame and fortune.
